Package org.loudouncodes.randkit.api

Class DistributionSupport

java.lang.Object
org.loudouncodes.randkit.api.DistributionSupport
public final class DistributionSupport extends Object
Describes the mathematical support (domain) of a probability distribution: numeric lower/upper bounds, whether each bound is closed (inclusive) or open (exclusive), and whether values are treated as continuous reals or discrete integers.

Typical examples:

  • Normal: (-∞, +∞) continuous
  • Exponential: [0, +∞) continuous
  • Poisson: {0,1,2,...} discrete
  • Beta: (0,1) continuous (open interval)

    DistributionSupport.Kind
    Indicates whether the distribution's values are continuous reals or discrete integers.

  • Method Details

    • lower

      public double lower()
      Returns the numeric lower bound.
      Returns:
      the lower bound, or Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY if unbounded below

    • upper

      public double upper()
      Returns the numeric upper bound.
      Returns:
      the upper bound, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if unbounded above

    • isLowerClosed

      public boolean isLowerClosed()
      Indicates whether the lower bound is included in the support (closed). Ignored when the support is unbounded below.
      Returns:
      true if the lower bound is closed; false otherwise

    • isUpperClosed

      public boolean isUpperClosed()
      Indicates whether the upper bound is included in the support (closed). Ignored when the support is unbounded above.
      Returns:
      true if the upper bound is closed; false otherwise

    • isUnboundedBelow

      public boolean isUnboundedBelow()
      Returns whether the support is unbounded below.
      Returns:
      true if the lower bound is Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY; otherwise false

    • isUnboundedAbove

      public boolean isUnboundedAbove()
      Returns whether the support is unbounded above.
      Returns:
      true if the upper bound is Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY; otherwise false

    • kind

      public DistributionSupport.Kind kind()
      Returns the value kind (continuous or discrete).
      Returns:
      the support kind

    • contains

      public boolean contains(double x)
      Tests whether a numeric value lies within this support's interval, respecting open/closed endpoints. For discrete supports, this method checks only the numeric interval; it does not require x to be an integer.
      Parameters:
      x - the value to test
      Returns:
      true if x lies in the support; false otherwise

    • continuous

      public static DistributionSupport continuous(double lower, boolean lowerClosed, double upper, boolean upperClosed)
      Creates a continuous (real-valued) support with the given bounds.
      Parameters:
      lower - the lower bound, or Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY for unbounded below
      lowerClosed - true if the lower bound is closed (included)
      upper - the upper bound, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY for unbounded above
      upperClosed - true if the upper bound is closed (included)
      Returns:
      a continuous DistributionSupport

    • discrete

      public static DistributionSupport discrete(double lower, boolean lowerClosed, double upper, boolean upperClosed)
      Creates a discrete (integer-valued) support with the given bounds.
      Parameters:
      lower - the lower bound, or Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY for unbounded below
      lowerClosed - true if the lower bound is closed (included)
      upper - the upper bound, or Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY for unbounded above
      upperClosed - true if the upper bound is closed (included)
      Returns:
      a discrete DistributionSupport
